title: Elkonstruktörer
description:
**Därför är detta jobb för dig:**
---------------------------------

Du brinner för att omvandla idéer till praktiska, tekniska lösningar och vill vara med och forma framtidens teknik. Om du vill utvecklas inom el- och kabelkonstruktion i en innovativ miljö där varje projekt erbjuder nya utmaningar och möjligheter att växa, är detta jobbet för dig. Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsplats där du får möjlighet att arbeta med avancerade tekniska lösningar inom branscher som försvar, automotive, Life Science, MedTech och industri.

**Arbetsuppgifter:**
--------------------

* Design och konstruktion av elsystem för maskiner och fordon.
* Utveckling av elektriska systemlösningar och lågspänningsapplikationer.
* Kabelritningar och kabelstamsdesign för automation och industriella maskinsystem.
* Utveckling och dokumentation av elsystem, inklusive skåpslösningar och komponenter.
* Hantering av produktutveckling inom R&D-miljöer, inklusive certifieringsprocesser (CE, UL, EMC).
* Testning och verifiering av elektriska skåp, kablar och kompletta system.

**Kvalifikationer:**
--------------------

* Kandidat- eller masterexamen inom elteknik, elektronik eller liknande område.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom elkonstruktion med fokus på elskåp, kabeldragning och lågspänningssystem
* Erfarenhet av CAD-verktyg som E³.series, Cadett Elsa, AutoCAD Electrical, E-plan eller liknande.
* Goda kunskaper om standarder som EMC, maskinsäkerhet och lågspänningsdirektiv.
* Erfarenhet av PDM/PLM-system som Aras, SAP eller projektledningsverktyg som Jira eller DevOps.
* Svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift.

**Vad vi erbjuder:**
--------------------

Hos Knightec arbetar kompetensintensiva konsulter som drivs av att utmana, skapa kundvärde och utveckla affärer. Vi har blivit utnämnda som en av Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare och konsultföretag. Med en kultur präglad av öppenhet och professionalism, erbjuder vi en inkluderande arbetsmiljö med stor mångfald.


Din arbetsplats blir vårt kontor i Solna, där du kommer att arbeta antingen ute hos våra kunder eller med inhouse-projekt. Våra kunder finns främst i Stockholm, Uppsala och Södertälje, och vi erbjuder flexibla lösningar och varierande uppdrag.

**Om Knightec:**
----------------


Knightec är en strategisk partner inom produkt- och tjänsteutveckling, dedikerade till att hjälpa företag driva positiv förändring för framtida affärsmöjligheter. Vi tror att samarbete och samskapande är nyckeln till framgång och närmar oss våra kunders utmaningar ur ett helhetsperspektiv. Våra experter från hela världen bidrar med unika perspektiv och färdigheter, och tillsammans med våra kunder skapar vi innovativa och hållbara lösningar.
**Ansökningsprocessen:**
------------------------

Skicka gärna in din ansökan med CV och personligt brev. Ansökningsperioden är öppen tillsvidare.

title: Software Tester
description:
**Want to be part of a company with a warm and friendly environment?**

  

If you are looking to gain experience in testing within Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations, this opportunity could be an excellent fit for you!
  

As a tester on ExFlow, you’ll be responsible for ensuring quality and will have the chance to advance your skills in a dynamic environment.

**About the job**


We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Software Tester to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will assist in ensuring the quality and functionality of ExFlow by performing various testing activities. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in both manual and automated testing, and a deep understanding of the software development lifecycle (SDLC).


**Responsibilities**


* Develop, execute, and maintain manual and automated scripts
* Identify, document, and manage bugs found during testing using Azure DevOps tool.
* Collaborate with product team, developers, and business analysts to understand system requirements.
* Perform regression, and system testing to ensure new changes do not disrupt existing functionality.
* Create and maintain detailed test documentation, including test cases and test scripts.
* Review requirements, specifications, and design documents to ensure accuracy and test readiness.
* Work with continuous improvement and be part of improving the quality assurance processes to ensure a good product.
* Setting up and maintenance of the test environments.

**Required Skills**


* Strong understanding of software testing methodologies, including functional, regression, system, integration, and user acceptance testing (UAT).
* High level of attention to detail to ensure tests are thorough and issues are well-documented.
* Skilled in both automated and manual testing
* Strong communication skills and a team-oriented approach to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
* Knowledge of software development life cycle (SDLC) and software testing life cycle (STLC).

**Other qualifications that would be nice**


* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field
* Knowledge in MS Azure DevOps
* ISTQB Foundation Level or equivalent certification is preferred.
* Knowledge in application MS D365 Finance/Supply Chain Management

To thrive in this role, you have good analytical skills, love problem-solving, you are a team player, and structure your tasks and priorities independently. You have an interest in helping others, like to learn new things, and to share your knowledge with others.


**What we can offer you**


* To be part of a successful Swedish company
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Helpful colleagues with great competence and experience
* A generous wellness contribution
* Health insurance and occupational pension
* Flexible working hours and the possibility of hybrid-remote working

**Additional** **information**

* Full-time, 40 hours per week
* Start date upon agreement

The office location is in a new, high-tech office just by Mall of Scandinavia, Solna  

* 

  

We encourage you to apply even if you don't meet all the listed requirements. Research shows that individuals from underrepresented groups, including women, often hesitate to apply unless they meet every qualification. At SignUp Software, we value diverse perspectives and experiences. If you're passionate about what we do and believe you could make an impact, we want to hear from you. Let us determine together if this could be the right opportunity for you.


Interviews take place on an ongoing basis during the process.

**About us**  

SignUp Software was founded in 1999 and introduced ExFlow in 2003. Over the years, SignUp Software has earned a strong reputation in the Microsoft Dynamics community for its solutions in financial process automation. The solutions in the ExFlow product portfolio are built in Microsoft Dynamics 365 and utilize Azure Services, specifically designed for the “Office of the CFO”.


SignUp Software currently operates from Sweden (where it is headquartered), Denmark, Netherlands, Germany, Spain, UK, USA, Canada, Singapore, Malaysia, and Australia, and has over 200 employees and partnerships with more than 100 resellers worldwide. Globally, over 1,500 customers rely on ExFlow to enhance their financial processes in more than 60 countries.

title: Data Manager for Data Catalog
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**What you will do**
--------------------


As a Data Manager for Data Catalog in our team, you will engage with various teams and business stakeholders to ensure documentation of data assets into the Data Catalog and define as well as manage the methodology for harvesting & managing metadata. You will work with the Data Management Tool, Informatica IDMC, and secure the enhancement and implementation of new capabilities.


This role requires knowledge and experience in Data Governance and Data Management, an analytical mindset, excellent structuring skills, as well as communication and stakeholder management skills, and a pragmatic can-do attitude to be part of and help drive the data transformation.

  

‘Data’ is a function within Volvo Digital & IT with the goal to unlock the power of data for the full Volvo Group to become a fully data-driven company! With data as the core component of our transformation journey, we will, together with our data talents, make the Volvo Group 2030 vision happen. We will take care of all aspects of Data, including quality assurance, documentation, availability, preparation, and use through BI, Analytics, and Machine Learning. We have an ambitious transformation ahead, with the implementation of the Data Layer in Azure and the reinforcement of Data Governance and Data Management across the entire Group.


The ‘Data’ function is a large multicultural organization with 600+ employees and contractors located mainly in 7 countries: Sweden, Poland, India, Belgium, Brazil, USA, and France.


This is a Flexible position, and in this role, you will be joining as a Data Manager for Data Catalog in Gothenburg (Sweden), Wroclaw (Poland) . Please mention the location while you apply.


We collaborate with other parts of the organization, including Volvo Digital & IT, Truck Divisions, Business Areas, and Group Functions. We foster an environment where ideas, thoughts, and opinions can be shared. We are team players with clear common ambitions, and we win together.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

  

* Advise and support stakeholders in using the Data Catalog.
* Collaborate with business representatives, information owners, data stewards, and architects.
* Promote the usage and enrichment of the Data Catalog.
* Coordinate with other internal Data Governance and Data Management products.
* Become an expert on Data Catalog and provide functional support and expertise to colleagues.
**Required Competence**
-----------------------

* Experience in Data Governance & Data Management.
* Familiarity with Informatica IDMC or similar tools focused on Data Governance and Catalog.
* Strong stakeholder management, communication, and organizational skills.
* Ability to present ideas and recommendations clearly.
* Knowledge of glossary and/or data modeling is an advantage.
* Experience in an agile setup, using DevOps or similar.
* Good understanding of both business and IT.
* Experience and passion for Data.
**Ready for Next Move**
-----------------------


Imagine yourself working with the sharpest and most creative brains in the transport and infrastructure industry, developing cutting-edge technologies and sustainable transport solutions that will change the future of society.  

  

For any questions please don't hesitate to reach out to Mathilda Janson ,Data Availability Manager mathilda.janson@volvo.com.


This role requires a balance of in-office and remote work, with an expectation to be in the office three days a week.


For candidates applying in EU , applicants must have a valid work permit to work in the EU.

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Digital & IT** is the hub for digital development within Volvo Group. Imagine yourself working with cutting-edge technologies in a global team, represented in more than 30 countries. We are dedicated to leading the way of tomorrow’s transport solutions, guided by a strong customer mindset and high level of curiosity, both as individuals and as a team. Here, you will thrive in your career in an environment where your voice is heard and your ideas matter.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Test Data Management - Implementor to SEB
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone..*
**What you will be doing**
Do you want to be part of our exciting solution rebuild? We will transition into a more modern Test Data Management (TDM) solution. Instead of developing our solution we will leverage the benefit of using a standard solution and customize it to our needs and requirements. We will add more value to our customers by proactively provide consistent test data. Join us in our journey!

You will be part of a professional Agile team responsible for providing tools for test data creation and de-identification that enable other SEB development teams to easily test their solutions. You will share your responsibilities with other team members.
### **Key responsibilities:**

* Be a key player in the implementation of a new modern TDM solution to ensure efficiency, consistency, and security in our innovative financial tech environment.
* Implement/onboard more and more data sources over time.
* Administrate, configure and maintain the new solution.
* Maintain current solutions during the transition period and support stakeholders(internal SEB development teams).
* Guiding for the teams to prepare relevant test data for their testing.

### **Must-have-skills:**

* Preferably you’re a Java developer with 1-2 years of experience or recent graduate, who is proactive and eager to take ownership.
* You have experience with containerization tools such as Docker and Kubernetes, ideally in a DevOps environment.
* You have experience working withboth Linux and Windows OS.
* Fluency in English.

### **Nice-to-have-skills:**

* Experience with Test Data Management solutions (e.g., K2view, Delphix, Datprof) or similar tools.
* Knowledge of database architecture and design.
* Experience in scripting (e.g., Bash) and automation.
* Experienced with testing and knowledge of what kind of test data is required.
* Knowledge of cloud technologies and DevOps tools.
* Understanding of application development for various platforms

### **Personal skills:**

* A curious mindset, willingness to develop yourself and learn new things.
* Analytical and structured: Being able to analyze and structure system dependencies.
* Collaborative and proactive problem solver who enjoys teamwork and taking initiative.
* Selfdriven and enjoys being responsible for different assignments and projects

### **What we offer:**

* Attractive compensation and benefits
* Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits
* Flexible work-life balance
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Innovative company in forefront of technology
* Agile and modern ways of working


This is not just a role – it’s a platform for growth. You’ll have the opportunity to deepen your technical skills, take ownership of exciting projects, and advance your career in a forward-thinking tech environment.  

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
**Ready to join us?**

Apply before Octobre the 20th, 2024. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis, so apply today!
**Learn more about working at SEB** **www.sebgroup.com/career**

SEB is one of the largest Tech employers in the Nordics. We are international, business savvy techies that contribute to or are responsible for SEB’s banking software, ensuring that both internal and external products and services are delivered fast and efficiently, that access is always on, and that solutions are trusted and compliant. We work hard to future-proof SEB with world class digital architecture and the deployment of new technologies.  

Read more: https://sebgroup.com/
company_description: More than 15.000 people work at SEB. Working in SEB means being part of an exciting journey, driven by digital transformation

title: Head of Finance, Scandinavia
description:
**Welcome to Eficode!**


We are building the future of software development - specializing in Cloud, DevOps, Agile, and Development. We help our customers transform into software-driven organizations, aiming to change the world by sharing our knowledge. Our employees value opportunities for growth, psychological safety and culture - we appreciate our laid-back and autonomous, but supportive atmosphere.


Here are a few reasons for why to join us:

  

* Opportunity to join a fast-growing global company
* Have a leadership role with significant impact on the regional business strategy, aligning with our global strategy
* We offer flexible and remote work opportunities so you can shape your work in the way that fits you the best
* Be part of a company that values innovation, leadership, and results

**Your role and responsibilities**


We are seeking an experienced and strategic **Head of Finance** to oversee all financial operations across the Scandinavia region (Sweden, Denmark, Norway), and ensure that we use capital and resources beneficially.


Reporting to the VP, Group Finance and part of the Scandinavian Leadership Team, the Head of Finance Scandinavia responsibilities include overseeing the financial operation of the region. The primary role includes managing the financial health of the region and increasing profitability in the long run for the region of the three legal entities, ensuring compliance with financial regulations, and supporting decision-making by providing financial insights.

  

Key responsibilities:

  

Financial Reporting, Planning and Analysis:


* Lead regional monthly, quarterly and annual financial reporting
* Lead the financial forecasting process across the region
* Conduct profit/loss, cost, and variance analyses to drive decision-making
* Optimize and automate financial reporting processes, ensuring accurate, timely and effective ways of working across the regional finance operation


Budgeting and Cost Management:


* Lead the creation and management of the region’s annual budget, ensuring alignment with overall company objectives
* Monitor expenditures, ensuring efficient allocation of resources and adherence to budgets


Treasury and Cash Flow Management:

* Oversee cash flow, ensuring that the company maintains adequate liquidity to meet its obligations
* Optimize working capital to improve financial flexibility


Investment & Risk Management:

* Assess and manage financial risks, including currency fluctuations, credit risks, and investment risks
* Ensure compliance with financial laws, tax regulations, and internal controls


Team Leadership:

* Supervise, mentor and develop a team of finance professionals in the region
* Foster a high-performance culture that encourages innovation and operational excellence


Financial Compliance & Security:

* Ensure all accounting, reporting, and internal audits comply with local regulations and international standards
* Liaise with auditors and regulatory bodies to maintain transparency and compliance
* Develop and implement secure financial procedures to maintain the confidentiality of sensitive information

Stakeholder Communication:

* Provide financial insights and reports to senior management and relevant stakeholders
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support company-wide financial initiatives
* Regional Leadership Team work

**Areas that will help you to stand out:**

* Proven work experience as a Head of Finance, Finance Director, or in a similar leadership role
* In-depth understanding accounting principles and cash flow management
* Hands-on experience with accounting, budgeting and risk management
* Excellent knowledge of financial data analysis and forecasting models
* Strong leadership skills and experience from leading and managing finance teams
* Solid analytical, strategic and decision-making abilities
* Full proficiency in English and either Swedish or Danish

BSc/BA in Accounting, Finance or a relevant field. MSc/MBA and/or relevant certifications (e.g. CFA/CPA) are seen as a benefit  
* 

**Apply today!**


Join us in shaping the financial future of our operations across the Scandinavian region! Please send your resume and cover letter outlining your experience and vision for this role **latest on the 18th of October 2024**. We look forward to reviewing your application!


*At Eficode we are committed to offering an inclusive recruitment process and equal opportunities for all applicants.* *We are dedicated to creating a work environment that embraces diversity, inclusion, and respect for all employees. We believe that our differences make us better. We recognize that by having diverse perspectives, skills, ages, genders, backgrounds and cultures we will better drive our customers forward and innovate in our field.*

*To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from sharing unnecessary personal information and your picture on your job application.*

*Eficode, better made possible.*

title: Experienced QA/Test Engineer
description:
Job Title
Experienced QA/Test Engineer
Job Description*Are you an engineer with passion for quality and test? Axis Communication continues to grow, and we are now looking for an experienced QA/Test engineer who want to drive the work of continuously improving and increasing the quality of our software deliveries and the quality of our IT products and systems. Does this sound like something to you? Apply today!*
Your future team
You will be part of our ITQA team, which is responsible for quality assurance of the software deliveries of several of Axis most critical and complex IT systems and solutions. In our daily business our test engineers within ITQA work in one of the many development teams which are responsible for developing and maintaining the different products and services. We are also involved in different projects within Information Systems. As part of our ITQA team you will have colleagues who share the same view of quality assurance and who together work for continuous improvements and increased quality of our software deliveries.
What you will do here as a QA/Test Engineer
As a QA/Test Engineer within ITQA you will drive the quality assurance and test work forward, both together with your colleagues within the ITQA team but primarily within the test area and development team which you will be part of. You will be responsible for developing and implementing the QA and test strategies for the specific product(s) of the development team, and on daily basis you are responsible for the planning, communication, coordination, and execution of test related activities.
As a QA/Test Engineer you will also:* Be working with quality assurance and test activities within the whole software development lifecycle, from analysis of new needs and requirements until production and continuous maintenance and improvement of the product.
* Be guiding and supporting the other engineers in how to build in quality as part of the software development process and the delivery process.
* Together with your QA/Test colleagues, you will cooperate to ensure the quality of larger user scenarios and data flows involving several products and applications.


Who are you?
We believe you have a genuine interest in test and quality assurance of software deliveries, and to think of quality and test early in the process as well as throughout the whole software development lifecycle. You are a practical engineer who is curious, responsible, structured, and methodical, who enjoys technology and are not afraid of complex system solutions. Just like us, you value the team and thrive working close and together with other skilled engineers. You love to share your knowledge and experience and continue to develop your own skills. You share the Agile mindset and approach and have experience in QA and Test in relation to Agile and DevOps. We believe you have a strong personal drive and communication skills, enjoy teamwork and welcome challenges in a positive way and with a holistic view.
We’d love to hear that you have:* A bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer science or from a related engineering discipline
* At least 5 years’ experience of testing and quality assurance within an Agile way of working
* Experience within technical testing and knowledge in API testing using Postman or similar
* Experience with automatic test and frameworks and continuous testing as part of a CI/CD pipeline
* Good communication skills, both in speech and written form in English


What Axis have to offer
By joining Axis, you will embark on an exciting journey of personal and professional growth. We will offer you a great introduction to Axis with training. Our team will support you, but also listen to your experiences and give you freedom to explore and realize your ideas. We are a fast-growing company that can offer you great career opportunities and a competitive package of benefits.  

In exchange for your dedication, Axis offers you a job in an open, friendly, and professional environment. We work in an innovative and global organization that takes great pride in delivering world-class, high-quality products, services, and solutions to our customers. Working with us gives you an excellent opportunity to develop in an organization promoting professional and individual growth. You will have a role where your operational effort really will be of great impact to the overall success of Axis. We want you to enjoy working with us, which is why we offer benefits such as flexible working hours, morning “fika” every day, Friday cake, company bonus, wellness allowance, health insurance and your very own Axis bicycle - to name a few.  

  

We also provide a brand new training facility free for every Axis employee. You can see it here Axis HQ.
We believe in sustainability, equality and inclusion. Read more here.  

Axis is an organization that values creativity and promotes teamwork and openness. With us you will grow both personally and professionally. You will be part of a team of great colleagues that enjoy going to work in the morning. Welcome!  

Curious to discover more?  

We have a host of places where you can learn more about Axis, our products, solutions, company culture, and what working at Axis is really like.  

  

Check out:
Life at Axis blog  

Engineering at Axis blog  

Innovation at Axis
Ready to Act?
Axis is a company realizing the benefits of a diverse workforce. We know that diversity in groups creates a better working environment and promotes creativity, something that is fundamental for our success. We welcome all applications. We are looking forward to getting to know you better and hope you will become a central person helping us and Axis to grow together.  

Apply today or find out more from our recruiting manager Ulrika Schönström ulrika.schonstrom@axis.com
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2024-10-23*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 4500 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast
company_description: Axis Communications is a global growth company with currently are about 4000 employees worldwide and offices in over 50 countries. We are expanding. Visit our webb page axis.com

title: Junior Testautomatiserare – Stockholm heltid
description:
Modernera är ett modernt rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag. www.modernera.se
  
För en kunds räkning söker vi nu en junior testautomatiserare. Vår kund levererar lösningar som gör att deras kunder kan öka förändringstakt och kvalitet i sina digitala tjänster. Företagets kunder finns främst bland teleoperatörer, offentlig sektor, bank och försäkring i Sverige och Norge. Företaget har funnits sedan 1999 och består idag av ett 50-tal medarbetare.
  
Du kommer att jobba i trevliga lokaler i centrala Stockholm. Det finns möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån.
  
Du kommer att arbeta i varierande projekt och stå inför intressanta utmaningar för att effektivisera företagets kunders tekniska vardag.
  
  

**Du har:**  

Utbildning på kandidatnivå
  
Upp till 3 års erfarenhet inom utveckling (som JavaScript, Python, C#/.Net, Java)
  
Enhetstestning (som JUnit, XUnit)
  
Förståelse för teststrategier
  
Förståelse för agila arbetssätt
  
  

**Meriterande:**  

Testautomationsverktyg (som Selenium, Cypress, Katalon, Postman, Soap-UI, pytest)
  
CI/CD-verktyg (som Azure DevOps, Gitlab, Jenkins)
  
ISTQB-certifiering
  
Versionshantering (som Git)
  
Kunskap inom mordern infrastruktur med containers/mikrotjänster (som kubernetesplattformar)
  
  

**Du får:**  

Arbeta i utmanande projekt med teknik i framkant
  
Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling där certifieringar är en självklarhet
  
Vara en del av en stimulerande arbetsmiljö med högt i tak
  
Åka på spännande konferensresor med roliga aktiviteter
  
Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, pensionsersättning, ett ordentligt friskvårdsbidrag och andra generösa förmåner
  
Du kommer att bli anställd hos vår kund. Heltid. Provanställning som övergår i en tillsvidareanställning efter sex månader. Tillträde: omgående.
  
Ansök genom att skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Skriv ”Junior Testautomatiserare – Stockholm heltid” i ärenderaden.

title: Senior testledare – Stockholm deltid
description:
Modernera är ett modernt rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag. www.modernera.se
  
För en kunds räkning söker vi nu en senior testledare. Vår kund levererar lösningar som gör att deras kunder kan öka förändringstakt och kvalitet i sina digitala tjänster. Företagets kunder finns främst bland teleoperatörer, offentlig sektor, bank och försäkring i Sverige och Norge. Företaget har funnits sedan 1999 och består idag av ett 60-tal medarbetare.
  
Du kommer att jobba i trevliga lokaler i centrala Stockholm. Det finns möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån.
  
Du kommer att arbeta i varierande projekt och stå inför intressanta utmaningar för att effektivisera företagets kunders tekniska vardag.
  
Vår kund tror på en välplanerad kunskapsutveckling för att tillsammans kunna erbjuda det bästa inom testledning. Du kommer att erbjudas en gedigen utvecklingsresa oavsett erfarenhetsnivå och dina kunskaper kommer omvandlas till nytta som gör skillnad. Du är alltid uppbackad av erfarna kollegor samt den gemensamma kunskapen som utgör kärnan i företagets framgångar.
  
Du är rätt för rollen om du har utbildning på kandidatnivå och har över 3 års erfarenhet av:
  
Programmering (JavaScript, Java)
  
Enhetstestramverk (JUnit, Cucumber)
  
Teknisk testning
  
Testautomationsverktyg (Selenium, Cypress, Playwright, Test Complete, UFT)
  
CI/CD-verktyg (Azure DevOps, Gitlab, Jenkins)
  
Agila arbetssätt
  
Versionshantering (Git)
  
  

**Meriterande är om du även har eller är van vid:**  

ISTQB-certifiering (om det saknas fixar vi det tillsammans)
  
Kunskap inom modern infrastruktur med containers/mikrotjänster (som Kubernetes plattformar)
  
Att ta fram teststrategier
  
Att coacha andra inom testautomation
  
Att sätta upp ramverk
  
Passar ovanstående in på dig och du vill vara en del av en stimulerande arbetsmiljö med högt i tak, få kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling, arbeta i projekt med teknik i framkant då är det bara att ansöka nu!
  
Du kommer att bli anställd hos vår kund. Deltid. Provanställning som övergår i en tillsvidareanställning efter sex månader. Tillträde: omgående.
  
Ansök genom att skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Skriv ”Senior testledare – Stockholm deltid” i ärenderaden.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Senseworks expanderar kraftigt och vi vill utöka teamet med en DevOps Engineer.
  
Om Senseworks
  
‍Senseworks startade 2019 och tillhandahåller en världsledande analys- och revisionsplattform som SaaS-tjänst på webben. Senseworks gör vårt samhälle bättre genom att göra det enkelt för revisorer, redovisningskonsulter och CFO: er att samarbeta och se till att företag drivs på bästa sätt.
  
Vem vi söker
  
‍Vi letar efter en driven och strukturerad DevOps Engineer till vårt DevOps-team. Du är van vid att jobba med Infrastructure as Code (IaC), Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes och moln som Azure, AWS eller GCP. Meriterande är om du har jobbat i verksamheter där det rör sig stora datamängder eller har erfarenhet av databaser som PostgreSQL eller ClickHouse, meddelandeköer som RabbitMQ, orkesterings-lösningar som Argo Workflows eller Airflow samt Node.js / TypeScript och Redis.
  
  

**Du kommer att trivas här om du:**  

Gillar att jobba i ett tight team där du har stora möjligheter att påverka.
  
Gillar att ta ansvar och ha stort inflytande över dina arbetsdagar.
  
  

Om rollen
  
**Senseworks används idag av allt från SME:** er till stora internationella byråer. Ditt jobb blir att hjälpa till att skapa ett väloljat maskineri för att skeppa features snabbt och tillförlitligt även framöver när teamet och antalet tjänster växer och vi levererar vår SaaS-tjänst internationellt.
  
  

**Dina mål inkluderar att:**  

Automatisera så mycket som möjligt av vår utveckling och driftsättning för att skapa snabb och tillförlitlig time-to-market (TTM) för nya funktioner.
  
Öka kvaliteten och tillgängligheten på våra tjänster för att leverera på våra SLA: n till kunder.
  
Se till att vi håller en hög säkerhets- och compliance-standard för vår utveckling och drift både för våra egna och tredjepartsprodukter.
  
  

**I rollen som DevOps Engineer ansvarar du för att:**  

Äga livscykeln för våra tredjepartsprodukter och driftade tjänster.
  
Äga utvecklarupplevelsen för våra utvecklarteam (DevEx).
  
Äga infrastrukturplattformen och relaterad automation och Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
  
Drifta våra tjänster - DevOps-teamet monitorerar vår infrastruktur och våra applikationer för att upptäcka och åtgärda problem och arbetar proaktivt för att göra våra system mer robusta över tid.
  
Arbeta med övriga engineering-teamet för att identifiera förbättringsområden för utveckling och deployment.
  
Bygga, produktionssätta, underhålla och drifta infrastrukturen och automationen som krävs för en SaaS-tjänst i världsklass.
  
Se till att våra utvecklings- och deployment-processer möter våra standarder för säkerhet och regelefterlevnad.
  
Kontinuerligt utvärdera nya verktyg och tekniker för att förbättra vår utvecklingshastighet, kvalitet och tillgänglighet.
  
  

Vad vi erbjuder
  
Vi erbjuder en chans att vara en del av ett snabbt växande fintech-företag. Vi erbjuder en inspirerande, snabb och samarbetsinriktad miljö där du får möjlighet att ta stort eget ansvar och påverka både din egen roll och dina arbetsdagar.
  
Att ha en utmärkt kultur och en rolig och engagerande arbetsmiljö är mycket viktigt för oss. Vi värdesätter nyfikenhet, öppenhet och en positiv attityd. Vi strävar efter att skapa en bra miljö för lärande och personlig utveckling och har en personlig utbildningsbudget för varje anställd så att vi alltid får fortsätta lära oss saker.
  
Vi tror att vi har roligare och utvecklar bättre produkter genom att arbeta mycket nära våra kunder, hela vägen från idé till backlog-prioritering, med ett datadrivet sätt för att ta beslut om vad vi ska bygga härnäst.
  
Vi anser att det är viktigt att erbjuda lika möjligheter för kvinnor och män eftersom vi tror att mångfaldiga arbetsstyrkor presterar bättre och är mycket roligare att arbeta i. Vi strävar efter att bygga ett långsiktigt team av talangfulla individer och som en del av det får alla anställda möjlighet att delta i vårt aktieoptionsprogram och bli ägare i företaget.
  
Vi har ett team med kollegor som arbetar från hela världen, men vi trivs också med att träffa varandra ansikte mot ansikte. Vårt kontor i Umeå ligger i Science Parken med 30 sekunders promenad till en av norra Europas största sportanläggningar på IKSU. Vi erbjuder ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag och en friskvårdstimme så att du kan träna på arbetstid. Vi har en mycket flexibel arbetsplats där du arbetar när och var det passar dig bäst för att få ihop livspusslet.
  
Kontaktinformation
  
‍Om att arbeta i ett snabbväxande SaaS-företag inom fintech låter spännande, kontakta oss!
  
Skicka din ansökan till jobs@senseworks.io.

title: Senior Azure Cloud Architect
description:
Join Nordcloud and make your mark on the European IT industry. Help our clients thrive on their cloud journey in solution areas such as infrastructure, migration, data, and security.


**Currently, we are looking for a Senior Azure Cloud Architect to join our team in Sweden.**


**Your** **daily responsibilities:**

  

* Participating in various customer projects, from implementing cloud foundations and platforms to transforming workloads into cloud native application
* Pre-sales activity including assisting with writing customer proposal
* Deep-diving into our customers' challenges by giving workshops and designing recommendations to technical teams and stakeholders
* You will become a trusted advisor for high-profile enterprises and jointly manage the customer relationship and roadmap with the Nordcloud account team
* You will have the opportunity to engage with our customers from the very start of the customer journey to the cloud and continue in your role on the customer projects until it's finished
* Acting as technical thought leader in customer engagements and amongst your peers at Nordcloud
* Occasional travelling in Sweden or Europe may be an option, depending on the assignment and your preferences


**Your key skills:**


* Hands-on experience with Cloud Architecture Design and/or Cloud Architectural Patterns for Development
* At least 5 years of experience in Public Cloud
* Advanced knowledge and hands-on experience with Azure (other public clouds such as AWS and GCP are a plus)
* Experience in leading complex large-scale projects
* Solid engineering/technical background/hands-on experience with conceptualizing, strategizing, and architecting cloud solutions
* Knowledge of security, network, virtualization, load balancer, storage, and database
* Hands-on experience with IaC (Infrastructure-as-Code) for managing the cloud
* Knowledge and experience around DevOps/DevSecOps and/or Platform Engineering as well as the ability to share, coach and mentor in these areas
* Active customer consultant and pre-sales attitude are a must
* Experience with enterprise customers or big organizations
* At least 3 years of experience working within the EU
* Fluent communication skills in both **English** and **Swedish**


**Skills we'd consider a plus:**


* Windows and/or Linux sys op background
* Previous experience in the design and delivery of systems based on IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS offerings, as well as exposure to different architecture models
* Passion to share your knowledge, mentor others in the team and lead if necessary
* Experience with building CI/CD pipelines
* Coding/scripting skills (Bash, Python, Powershell, or similar)
* Experience in consultancy


All in all, you should have a solid engineering/technical background/hands-on experience with conceptualizing, strategizing and architecting cloud solutions. As you will work directly with customers, social skills and a customer service attitude are a must. We favor critical/logical thinking, curiosity, and attention to detail over extensive but unstructured knowledge.


We encourage you to **apply**, even if you don't meet all of the requirements. We value your growth potential and enthusiasm!

  

**What we offer:**

  

* Individua**l training budget** and **exam fees** for certifications
* Flexible working hours and hybrid working model
* Laptop and equipment of your choice
* **Local package** such as six weeks of vacation, a pension package, private health care through EuroAccident, wellness benefits (Friskvårdsbidrag), and you can also pick more benefits from benify.se
* We are part of the collective bargaining agreement (Almegas Kollektivavtal - Tech Sverige)


Please read our Recruitment Privacy Policy (https://nordcloud.com/recruitment-privacy-policy/) before applying. **All applicants must have the right to work in Sweden.**


(http://www.benify.se/)


**About Nordcloud**


Nordcloud, an IBM company, is a European leader in cloud advisory, implementation, application development, managed services, and training. With 10 European hubs and over 1200 employees, we are known for our innovative cloud-native solutions and we have delivered over 1000 successful cloud projects (https://nordcloud.com/case-studies/).


Learn more at nordcloud.com (https://nordcloud.com/) and follow the #NordcloudCommunity (https://www.instagram.com/nordcloudcommunity/).


*Nordcloud values diversity and is dedicated to providing equal opportunities for all candidates and employees.*
